explains: adv. 显著地，明显地；超群地，惹人注目地

sentences.en: Britain continues to follow U.S. policy in this and other areas where American policies have most conspicuously failed.
sentences.cn: 英国在这个以及其他领域继续跟随美国已经明显失败了的政策。

sentences.en: Its images, allusions, and diction are conspicuously remote from the common "range of utterance".
sentences.cn: 它的形象、典喻和措辞明显远离普通的“话语范围”。

sentences.en: Women were conspicuously absent from the planning committee.
sentences.cn: 引人注意的是，规划委员会里没有一个女性委员。
